display: PDF Conjurer (backend) | Add column into advanced table on PDF

ANW.caption: Insert the previous PDF Conjurer Server-side step result
ANW.name: config_info

ANY.caption: Table name
ANY.doc: Name of the table that will receive this column.
ANY.name: table_name

ANZ.caption: List of items
ANZ.doc: A list of texts, number, dates and anything else supported. Will be the body of the column.
ANZ.name: items_list

ANa.caption: Text body style
ANa.doc: The name of the text style to be applied to the texts in this column.
ANa.name: text_body_style

ANb.caption: Column width
ANb.doc: How much space the column will take.
ANb.name: column_width

ANc.caption: Fixed width size
ANc.doc: If you select the option "Fixed width" in the dropdown above, then you have to specify it here. This will be ignored if you select the another option.
ANc.name: specified_column_width

ANd.caption: Column header
ANd.doc: Optional. The text that will be in the header, works as a title or label. Header examples are "Name, Phone, Email, Cost".
ANd.name: column_header

ANe.caption: Header style
ANe.doc: The name of the text style to be applied to the text of this column's header.
ANe.name: header_style

ANf.caption: Using images
ANf.doc: Some of the fields below is only relevant if you're using images in this column. Pass "yes" here and the list will be rendered as an image list. You can pass both "image" field type or a "text" field type containing a list of image URLs.
ANf.name: using_images

ANg.caption: Image width
ANg.doc: You can leave this empty, then it will use the image's original size. Specify only width and the image will scale proportionaly, specify both width and height and the image will distort to fit. Applied to the entire column.
ANg.name: image_width

ANh.caption: Image height
ANh.doc: You can leave this empty, then it will use the image's original size. Specify only width and the image will scale proportionaly, specify both width and height and the image will distort to fit. Applied to the entire column.
ANh.name: image_height

ANi.caption: Below you will be able to set extra margins for your image or text element. Leave the field as "no" for a default display. (Will ignore any numbers below)
ANi.name: margin_info

AOR.caption: Parse BBCode?
AOR.doc: If "Yes", it will interpret [b]hello[/b] as a bold hello. Search the web to understand what BBCode is. Official is: https://www.bbcode.org/ To help, BBCode is what is outputted by rich text editors.  All standard BBCode tags are supported, except for the video tag. At the site above you will be able to see what are the standard tags.  The style defined in BBCode will override the style defined in the "Define new style for" action.  Non-standard tags that are outputted by Bubble's rich text editors are supported as well. The legacy rich text editor from Bubble will work fine. A new one from Bubble uses a different line break scheme, this means line breaks will sometimes disappear, in other words, some "new line"s will be "skipped" or "eaten". This new line problem will not affect the table itself, it will only affect the text content inside the cell.
AOR.name: parse_bbcode
